intro: Dasymaschalon obtusipetalum, commonly known as the broad-petaled dasymaschalon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with five lobed petals. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, spherical fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
